spanishExample: ¡Entra! Encontré treinta y dos rojos.
englishTranslation: Come in! I found thirty-two red ones.
vocabIncluded: encontré: found, I found (Encontrar, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: ¡Mátalo! Ya entró en ese lugar.
englishTranslation: Kill him! He already entered that place.
vocabIncluded: entró: entered, he/she/it entered (Entrar, preterite, 3rd person)
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things

spanishExample: ¿Encontraste a las personas que lo mataron?
englishTranslation: Did you find the people who killed him?
vocabIncluded: "the personal a": using an extra "a" before a direct object when it's a person
encontraste: found, you found (Encontrar, preterite, 2nd person)
mataron: killed, they killed (Matar, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: ¿Encontraste el verde?
englishTranslation: Did you find the green one?
vocabIncluded: encontraste: found, you found (Encontrar, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¿Quién está entrando ahora? Mi vista no es buena.
englishTranslation: Who is entering now? My eyesight is not good.

spanishExample: Cuando entren en la habitación, habrá treinta y un hombres.
englishTranslation: When they enter the room, there will be thirty-one men.
vocabIncluded: entren: enter, they enter (Entrar, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)
habrá: "there will be" indicating existence (Haber, future, impersonal)

spanishExample: Desde mi punto de vista, tú lo mataste.
englishTranslation: From my point of view, you killed him.
vocabIncluded: mataste: killed, you killed (Matar, preterite, 2nd person)
punto de vista: point of view (idiom)

spanishExample: El trabajo me mata y solo tengo treinta y siete años.
englishTranslation: Work kills me and I’m only thirty-seven.
vocabIncluded: mata: kills, he/she/it kills (Matar, present, 3rd person)
tener X años: to be X years old (idiom)

spanishExample: Ella encontró la información, pero nosotros no la encontramos.
englishTranslation: She found the information, but we didn’t find it.
vocabIncluded: encontramos: found, we found (Encontrar, preterite, 1st person plural)
encontró: found, he/she/it found (Encontrar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Encontrará el asunto, tiene mi permiso.
englishTranslation: He will find the issue, he has my permission.
vocabIncluded: encontrará: will find, he/she/it will find (Encontrar, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Encontrarás a la persona que la mató.
englishTranslation: You’ll find the person who killed her.
vocabIncluded: "the personal a": using an extra "a" before a direct object when it's a person
encontrarás: will find, you will find (Encontrar, future, 2nd person)
mató: killed, he/she/it killed (Matar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Encontraré el mensaje porque ella quiere que lo encuentre.
englishTranslation: I will find the message because she wants me to find it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
encontraré: will find, I will find (Encontrar, future, 1st person)
encuentre: find, I find (Encontrar, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: Encontraron la información que necesitaban.
englishTranslation: They found the information they needed.
vocabIncluded: encontraron: found, they found (Encontrar, preterite, 3rd person plural)
necesitaban: needed, they needed (Necesitar, imperfect, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Encuentra una forma de darles tu atención.
englishTranslation: Find a way to give them your attention.
vocabIncluded: les: "them" as an indirect object ("to them", "for them")

spanishExample: Entré en esta habitación porque me gusta la vista.
englishTranslation: I entered this room because I like the view.
vocabIncluded: entré: entered, I entered (Entrar, preterite, 1st person)
gusta: likes, he/she/it likes (Gustar, present, 3rd person)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")

spanishExample: Es un secreto, pero creo que no lo recuerdan.
englishTranslation: It’s a secret, but I think they don’t remember it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)
recuerdan:  remember/remind, they  remember/remind (Recordar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Ese mensaje no te dice toda la situación.
englishTranslation: That message doesn’t tell you the whole situation.
vocabIncluded: te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

spanishExample: Eso no es asunto tuyo, es un secreto.
englishTranslation: That’s none of your business; it’s a secret.

spanishExample: Ha matado treinta, quizás treinta y uno.
englishTranslation: She has killed thirty, maybe thirty-one.
vocabIncluded: ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Hay treinta y una cosas en esta situación, no treinta y cinco.
englishTranslation: There are thirty-one things in this situation, not thirty-five.
vocabIncluded: hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)

spanishExample: Lo encontraremos, no te preocupes, ella siempre lo encuentra todo.
englishTranslation: We’ll find it, don’t worry, she always finds it all.
vocabIncluded: encontraremos: will find, we will find (Encontrar, future, 1st person plural)
encuentra: finds, he/she/it finds (Encontrar, present, 3rd person)
preocuparse: any use of to worry with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to to be worried)

spanishExample: No encuentro mi teléfono, quizás ella recuerde dónde lo puse.
englishTranslation: I don’t find my phone, maybe she remembers where I put it.
vocabIncluded: dónde: adverb meaning "where?" in a question or implied question
encuentro: find, I find (Encontrar, present, 1st person)
puse: put, I put (Poner, preterite, 1st person)
recuerde:  remember/remind, he/she/it  remember/remind(Recordar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No entramos cuando nos dijo.
englishTranslation: We didn’t enter when she told us.
vocabIncluded: entramos: entered, we entered (Entrar, preterite, 1st person plural)
nos: "us" as an indirect object ("to us", "for us")

spanishExample: No lo han encontrado.
englishTranslation: They haven’t found him.
vocabIncluded: han: "have", "they have" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: No recuerda si era verde o rojo.
englishTranslation: She doesn’t remember if it was green or red.
vocabIncluded: "o": "or" when used between items in a list
recuerda: remembers/reminds, he/she/it  remembers/reminds (Recordar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No recuerdo si maté veintiséis o treinta y cuatro.
englishTranslation: I don’t remember if I killed twenty-six or thirty-four.
vocabIncluded: "o": "or" when used between items in a list
maté: killed, I killed (Matar, preterite, 1st person)
recuerdo:  remember/remind, I  remember/remind (Recordar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: No tienes que matarme.
englishTranslation: You don’t have to kill me.
vocabIncluded: using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Quieren que yo recuerde que aún no han entrado.
englishTranslation: They want me to remember that they haven’t entered yet.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
han: "have", "they have" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person plural)
recuerde:  remember/remind, I  remember/remind (Recordar, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: Quiero que encuentre la puerta azul.
englishTranslation: I want him to find the blue door.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
encuentre: find, he/she/it find (Encontrar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Quiero que lo recuerdes, entonces tienes que tratar de recordarlo.
englishTranslation: I want you to remember it, so you have to try to remember it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
de used after Tratar to mean “try to”
recuerdes:  remember/remind, you  remember/remind (Recordar, subjunctive, 2nd person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Quiero que recuerden que mi vista es mala.
englishTranslation: I want them to remember that my eyesight is bad.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
recuerden:  remember/remind, they  remember/remind (Recordar, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Quizás encuentren el número veintinueve con tu permiso.
englishTranslation: Maybe they’ll find number twenty-nine with your permission.
vocabIncluded: encuentren: find, they find (Encontrar, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Recordaré tu punto de vista.
englishTranslation: I’ll remember your point of view.
vocabIncluded: punto de vista: point of view (idiom)
recordaré: will  remember/remind, I will  remember/remind(Recordar, future, 1st person)

spanishExample: Recuerda que no me gusta el azul.
englishTranslation: Remember that I don’t like the blue one.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
gusta: likes, he/she/it likes (Gustar, present, 3rd person)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")

spanishExample: Si encuentras treinta y ocho, dime algo sobre estos.
englishTranslation: If you find thirty-eight, tell me something about these.
vocabIncluded: encuentras: find, you find (Encontrar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Si entramos ahora, no sabremos cuál es el asunto.
englishTranslation: If we enter now, we won’t know what the issue is.
vocabIncluded: entramos: enter, we enter (Entrar, present, 1st person plural)
sabremos: "will know", "we will know" (Saber, future, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Si entras en esta habitación, verás una gran vista.
englishTranslation: If you enter this room, you’ll see a great view.
vocabIncluded: entras: enter, you enter (Entrar, present, 2nd person)
gran: "big"/"grand" when used right before a noun (adjective)
verás: will see, you will see (Ver, future, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Si entro en la casa, me podrían matar.
englishTranslation: If I enter the house, they could kill me.
vocabIncluded: entro: enter, I enter (Entrar, present, 1st person)
podrían: "would be able", "they would be able" (Poder, conditional, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Si lo mata, no es asunto tuyo.
englishTranslation: If she kills it, it’s none of your business.
vocabIncluded: mata: kills, he/she/it kills (Matar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Siempre encontramos lo que necesitamos, pero nunca lo recuerdas.
englishTranslation: We always find what we need, but you never remember it.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
encontramos: find, we find (Encontrar, present, 1st person plural)
necesitamos: need, we need (Necesitar, present, 1st person plural)
recuerdas:  remember/remind, you  remember/remind (Recordar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Su atención es importante si entra en la habitación.
englishTranslation: Her attention is important if she enters the room.
vocabIncluded: entra: enters, he/she/it enters (Entrar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Tiene que recordar que ya entraron en la habitación.
englishTranslation: She has to remember that they already entered the room.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entraron: entered, they entered (Entrar, preterite, 3rd person plural)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things

spanishExample: Tienes que encontrarlo, porque si ellos lo encuentran primero, tendrán treinta.
englishTranslation: You have to find it, because if they find it first, they’ll have thirty.
vocabIncluded: encuentran: find, they find (Encontrar, present, 3rd person plural)
tendrán: "will have", "they will have" (Tener, future, 3rd person plural)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Tienes que entrar por la puerta número veintitrés.
englishTranslation: You have to enter door number twenty-three.
vocabIncluded: por to mean “vía/by”, as in "by phone”
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation
